intro: Faramea aristata, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its stems are often covered in fine hairs. Faramea aristata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
